website_summaries.verdict: Scribblenauts Unlimited continues the franchise's penchant for ridiculousness, though lackluster puzzles temper the excitement.
pros: Thousands of objects and creatures to experiment withBonus objectives provide puzzling questionsCreation tools allow even more imaginative offerings
cons: Standard puzzles are easyLogical solutions aren't always accepted

customer_reviews.title: ... 8 year old son and 10 year old daughter love this game
customer_reviews.text: My 8 year old son and 10 year old daughter love this game. It is their new 'go to' when they have free time. I like that they have to spell words to play. The other day I was asked, "Mom, what do doctors need for surgery?" "Um, a scalpel." WOW. They love changing their characters and it keeps them engaged with one other while they play. They are cooperating to play the game rather than playing against one another, such as a racing game.
customer_reviews.author: Luv_Being_Mommy

customer_reviews.title: awesome game
customer_reviews.text: Super fun game for kids and adults. easy to play, lot's of clean fun. I can play for hours(I'm 28), and my little sister (who's 11) loves it, too. Just make sure you don't create zombies. Seriously. They will mess everything up and you'll loose the game. Everyone will be a zombie. It's impossible to come back from. Even the animals.
customer_reviews.author: T. Dolan

customer_reviews.title: ... shrink wrap but other than that it has been good, word rich-fun for my son
customer_reviews.text: Item came without its shrink wrap but other than that it has been good, word rich-fun for my son. Younger children will not understand how to correct some issues, such as when you are touched by a zombie and in turn "zombify" anything you touch. Also although its vocabulary is good, we often encountered situations where the program did not understand a word and/or its context. I must admit I am biased and giving this game an extra star because of its "educational" aspect :0)
customer_reviews.author: Monk Sage

customer_reviews.title: Best educational game I've ever seen
customer_reviews.text: This is a knock-it-out-of-the-park hit. Kids love it. They come back to it voluntarily. The best thing is that the game is truly free-form without any nanny-state limitations - good or bad. If your kid wants to create a gun to shoot the people, the game permits it. It's up to the parent to counsel the child on the behavior, but the game, like any good tool, is at the service of the user. I definitely will get the other Scribblenauts game soon!
customer_reviews.author: Todd Justman

customer_reviews.title: Decent Game
customer_reviews.text: Was fun, but very disappointing. The first two Scribblenauts games were more focused around playing around and coming up with creative solutions to see what you could create. This version centers more around doing missions, however you have a bit more freedom to play. There is no longer a limit to how much can be created. Another feature that I enjoyed was the ability to make your own creations and post them online for others to download.
customer_reviews.author: Ted

customer_reviews.title: My kids got this as a Christmas present. My ...
customer_reviews.text: My kids got this as a Christmas present. My 13 year old can't keep his hands off of it. He creates characters for the other two young ones and it keeps them all preoccupied for hours. I try to give them each an hour to play. My youngest is starting to put words in, learning his spelling. The other two is developing their creativity with the characters they create. I, sometimes, think when they're done with it, I may want to play it too. LOL.
customer_reviews.author: CCmotherof3

customer_reviews.title: scribblenaunts
customer_reviews.text: If you are new to scribblenuts it is a puzzle game where you must create objects by spelling them. While it is not a educational game it sure doesn’t hurt when you kids are asking you how to spell stuff while playing a game it also makes them use adjectives to better use a object like a huge snake or something like that. Overall it is a very fun game and some times the best part is just what stuff you can create
customer_reviews.author: moe

customer_reviews.title: 8 years love it!
customer_reviews.text: I've never heard of Scribblenauts before until we got the WiiU and our my 8 years want this game as his Christmas list.I think this is really a great game- very innovative. It makes good use of the touchpad. Our son loves the Scribblenauts games! They are so cute and fun! Very happy with our purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Nitya Hartley

customer_reviews.title: Cool game
customer_reviews.text: My 9 yr old asked for this and my hubby & I can't help but watch him play.. looks like fun!
customer_reviews.author: Jeannie LoVullo

customer_reviews.title: Cool Wii Game
customer_reviews.text: Wii game for my daughter that involves problem solving. Great price.
customer_reviews.author: Jolt

customer_reviews.title: Disgusted. Spent $165 in total and NOTHING works
customer_reviews.text: So disapointed that this seller is deceiving Australian buyers. I bought this game for my kids for Christmas and they couldn't use it as it's not compatible with their WiiU console. An honest seller would mark clearly that the games are not compatible with Australia. Disgusted. Spent $165 in total and NOTHING works.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Great Game
customer_reviews.text: Beautifully made game with a pretty but cute art direction, and a solid expansion off of the previous games. The increased uniqueness demonstrated by the Nintendo characters being present only highlights some of the great creations that can be possible in this game. This is definitely a high recommendation. Even the story, despite its apparent "tedious" method of collecting Starites, becomes easy as, a lot of the time, you can achieve goals without realizing it! It challenges your creativity.
customer_reviews.author: Haseeb Waseem

customer_reviews.title: Not for Non-Readers
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 5 year old thinking it would help him with reading. This game really requires being able to read to enjoy it. It has great potential for early readers. For now, I have to play the game with my child, so it's not holding his interest yet.
customer_reviews.author: KK

customer_reviews.title: surprisingly great game
customer_reviews.text: i had no idea what to expect when we bought this for my 6 yr old. but it has really peaked his interest in learning to spell. that as well as learning to describe objects, figure out what nouns are, adjectives, different things I was surprised to see. my 62 yr old mom helps my son off and on. so if we can all get into it, its worth it 100%.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Cheer

customer_reviews.title: What a fun game!
customer_reviews.text: What a fun game!!! Great price and my son couldn't be happier, the cool thing about this game is that it is word based so if he wants something he needs to know how to spell it! His vocabulary is already growing and it's a good way to pass time as a family!
customer_reviews.author: Noahsdad13

customer_reviews.title: Probably best for kids 7+
customer_reviews.text: My six year old loves it. Very different kind of game, one that causes the player to think creatively. A bit too much for a six year old, so I have to help him out from time to time. Probably best for kids 7+. Highly recommend it as a good learning tool/game for kids!!
customer_reviews.author: R. Maeda

customer_reviews.title: making words fun
customer_reviews.text: This game is really fun and creative. We can sit down as a family (2, 4, 6 yr old and mom and dad), and have a fun time solving problems with words! It appeals to my children, but also to me. I would play the game by myself. Since my 6 yr old is still learning to spell and read, I run the controller and the kids shout out suggestions, and we have lots of fun.
customer_reviews.author: B. Baillio

customer_reviews.title: Kids love it!
customer_reviews.text: Lots of freedom for your imagination to run wild. My two sons, 9 and 13, really enjoy the game. It seems much better than games that do not use your imagination, less of a waste of time! We limit video games very much, but this one has redeeming qualities (spelling practice and creativity).
customer_reviews.author: jmsh

customer_reviews.title: The kids thought this was great. I'm not going to lie it was a ...
customer_reviews.text: The kids thought this was great. I'm not going to lie it was a lot of fun creating a custom flying elephant named George with my nieces and nephews. You can save your creations too! So now all we have to do is type in George and out pops our custom flying elephant.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: This is the 3rd time we've bought this game. ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the 3rd time we've bought this game. One wore out and one got lost. My son is now 12 and still enjoys it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fun and Creative!
customer_reviews.text: Got it for my 10 year old Nephew and my 7 year old wanted one too! Great fun game that encourages kids to be creative in their problem solving (and silly).
customer_reviews.author: Rhiannan

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: My 9 year old son just LOVES this game! He started with DS and got the WiiU for Christmas and plays this game at every chance! =) It is a GREAT game to practice spelling! Even his 5 year old brother tries so hard to play!
customer_reviews.author: AmyScrapSpot

customer_reviews.title: perfect for the little screen
customer_reviews.text: My kids love this game! My littlest ones are learning how to read and spell so it really helps them with words. Also it's crazy creative. Bonus Plus.... works great on the little wii u screen so I can watch tv while they're playing. Epic Win!
customer_reviews.author: chubbybubba

customer_reviews.title: Fun but short
customer_reviews.text: A lot of fun but the game play didn't last long. Finished the game in a couple days (didn't play all day). There are a lot of words that you can add to create objects but there are a lot missing as well, so you can't get too creative. It is definitely a lot of fun but it is just one of those cost to benefit (fun) decisions.
customer_reviews.author: Gates

customer_reviews.title: decent fun game
customer_reviews.text: If you played the ones on the DS Then this will be familiar to you. the price is cheap on amazon and its a good time waster. Go ahead and buy it. It's sort of cool.
customer_reviews.author: Psycho Metal

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a solid first grader or an advanced kindergartener.
customer_reviews.text: Good phonics training for small children. Forces them to think of new vocabulary words, grapple with convoluted English spelling rules and engage with their older siblings to solve problems.
customer_reviews.author: infrequent buyer

customer_reviews.title: Love thus game.
customer_reviews.text: Wow what can I say. This was my sons favorite game for a very long time. To boot it educational.
customer_reviews.author: twilite2000Top Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: Fun and educational
customer_reviews.text: Our son loves the Scribblenauts games! They are so cute and fun! They make spelling and learning a lot of fun!!!
customer_reviews.author: M. Faulkner

customer_reviews.title: SO ADORABLE
customer_reviews.text: It's SO CUTE!! Seriously, this game makes you use your imagination in order to help others. It's so open to the mind so yeah, this game is unlimited. I broke the game when I spawned Ganondorf...
customer_reviews.author: Moondip

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Best game out there for using imagination and improving spelling skills - no wonder it's an award winner!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Smart fun
customer_reviews.text: My kids finding hilarious. It's fun to see them playing. Even when they are in a big group. It's the only game that my 14 year daughter plays.
customer_reviews.author: M. Punte

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant game.
customer_reviews.text: Brilliant game for using our imagination. Younger children will need help. My 7-year old absolutely LOVES this game.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Kimber

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: ITs a very good game, and i actually got it for 9.99 plus shipping to Mexico so i guess for the price i got a good game, Amazon's great as always witrh the shipment

customer_reviews.title: Great learning game
customer_reviews.text: I bout this for my 4 year old he is still way to your g to play but I play with him and it is teaching him to spell
customer_reviews.author: AMR83

customer_reviews.title: kids like it
customer_reviews.text: I'm not too fond of this type of game, so my insight is through my son. He likes it a lot. He likes being able to draw and customize on the gameplay. It is a really neat game.
customer_reviews.author: Tabs

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Solid game, lots of levels and possibilites. A solid improvement on earlier Scribblenauts releases.
customer_reviews.author: machinebreaker

customer_reviews.title: My son loves this game and it help teach him ...
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this game and it help teach him to spell and problem solve. It blows my mind that any noun we can conceive this game has it.
customer_reviews.author: Mike from IL

customer_reviews.title: Pretty fun game.
customer_reviews.text: Very interesting game, though sort of easy as well... You think of a lot of different ways to change your character, scenery, think of almost anything at all and it magically appears with your handy notebook!
customer_reviews.author: P. H.

customer_reviews.title: but still a good game for
customer_reviews.text: Daughter had some difficulties with this game, but still a good game for learning

customer_reviews.title: Fun game
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 4 year old son. He is not quite on the same level as it, but his mom and I love to play it
customer_reviews.author: Gary Cox

customer_reviews.title: scribblenauts fun
customer_reviews.text: great game , my son who is a huge scribblenauts fan loves it and cant wait to get home from school and play it.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy Cerroni

customer_reviews.title: Super awesome game.  You should get it if you don't already have it.
customer_reviews.text: Apparently, this is a super awesome game and my grandkids already have it so back it goes. :-(
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Great game!
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this game. It requires him to use his imagination, which is important.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Kabitzke

customer_reviews.title: Gift that keeps on giving
customer_reviews.text: This was a Christmas gift for one of my grandchildren. He is still playing the game and has not tired of it. That's a winner for an eight-year-old and his Grammy.
customer_reviews.author: Regina Jones

customer_reviews.title: Kids are thrilled!
customer_reviews.text: This is such a fun creative game and I love listening to my boys giggle as they create. It was great to order it from Amazon and save some $ too!
customer_reviews.author: Amy Jo

customer_reviews.title: Best E game of the year
customer_reviews.text: This game provides endless possibilities and loads of game play. I am often challenged with providing creative solutions, when in doubt, I create a back hole. Please note, if purchasing for a child, the child will need to have a basic vocabulary skills. The software will provide helpful suggestions for misspelled words.
customer_reviews.author: melp_36

customer_reviews.title: Education and Fun
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my nephew for his 4th birthday. He loves it, and my sister said it's one of the best educational games they have tried.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Van Reed

customer_reviews.title: Holds the attention of a 6 & 7 year old, very pleased!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: My children love this game. For ages 6 & 7 they are learning to play with ease and having fun in the process. Highly recommended, great game.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Would definitely recommend to others
customer_reviews.text: My kid loves this game, and it's really improving his spelling. Would definitely recommend to others. Only downside is that I wish it was a 2 player game.
customer_reviews.author: April Layao

customer_reviews.title: You need to be able to read and spell pretty well to play this one
customer_reviews.text: My 8 year old loves this game! You need to be able to read and spell pretty well to play this one.

customer_reviews.title: Son loves it
customer_reviews.text: It's a favorite with my son and his friends. They are all asking their parents for a copy. Hours of fun.

customer_reviews.title: He and his friends love playing with it on WII-U
customer_reviews.text: My 8 yr old grandson loves it! He and his friends love playing with it on WII-U.

customer_reviews.title: Great for my 5yo and 7yo boys
customer_reviews.text: This game helps with spelling and creative problem solving. It is interesting to see how they figure it out, or don't figure it out.
customer_reviews.author: shadetree

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great for younger kids. My son loved it. He likes the creative aspect of it.

customer_reviews.title: Happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: Product exactly as described. No complaints. Happy with my purchase.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars

customer_reviews.title: Good follow on to the DS version
customer_reviews.text: This was the first WiiU game I purchased for our son (12); as it turned out, it was one he wanted. He plays some action games, but also likes things like Little Planet and Scribblenauts. Both he and our 10 year old daughter like it.

customer_reviews.title: Great fun for anyone.
customer_reviews.text: Enjoyable game for all ages. I'm 19 and loved just about every minute of this.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this game, it really inspires creative thinking.

customer_reviews.title: Great fun!
customer_reviews.text: Great game! I actually wish that my son would play this more!

customer_reviews.title: Invalid disc
customer_reviews.text: The disc we received was invalid. It is not dirty it just doesn't work. Real nice!

customer_reviews.title: Super fun!
customer_reviews.text: I have played the games in the past, but wonder what was up with starites and why Maxwell has to gather them. I love this game and play it just as much as my son. We try to come up with strange combos and funny things to put in the game. Non stop fun!
customer_reviews.author: KB

customer_reviews.title: Unique is the only way to describe this.
customer_reviews.text: This game is different and unique than other games. Only way to find out is play it yourself! It can be easy but challenging to . Definitely makes you think about your vocabulary.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This game is perfect for all ages. Great way to fuel the imagination.

customer_reviews.title: Grandson loves it
customer_reviews.text: My Glenn played it for hours and then shared it with me. I liked it as well. Nice game to bridge the generation gap.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great game for kids and they actually have to think when playing this game.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great game but your kiddo must be a proficient reader...
customer_reviews.author: mimi

customer_reviews.title: Plenty of Fun
customer_reviews.text: I am a fan of Scribblenauts for a while. I played it on iOS and Android, but truly the Wii U version will take you to a different level of fun. Plenty of possibilities and challenges. The game is so smartly designed that even when you create the same item again it may be differently presented. For example when you create a person, you will have a diversity of female or male characters. It is plenty of fun and it is totally kids friendly.
customer_reviews.author: A.D.D.

customer_reviews.title: Fun
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my nephew, he loves it. Have not p;ayed it myself, but it is a favorite of his.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars

customer_reviews.title: Great game

customer_reviews.title: Fun and interesting!
customer_reviews.text: Like prior versions, the game challenges you to be creative and encourages you to expand your vocabulary. The dictionary is impressive, but at the same time, disappointed that some "didn't compute".

customer_reviews.title: Great game for the Wii U. Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: We love it. Hours of entertainment for 8 to 14 crowd. Worth every penny. Great graphics and interaction with the Wii U and game pad.

customer_reviews.title: Fun, but a little too easy.

customer_reviews.text: This is a fun game. You can create, edit, almost anything you can imagine. Fun to play on the TV or you can play it on the gamepad. Recommends

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Its for the kids and that's great - but as a full grown adult I hated it. My son got pretty tired of it soon afterwards and we returned to Mario. The gameplay is not intuitive, the controls are clunky and the pace is hampered by the typing in of words. Overall not what I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Garrett Hogan

customer_reviews.title: Not as great as i anticipated
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for the wife since she loves cute games and is creative. The game isn't as open-ended and sanbox as it advertises and some situations were actually harder to figure out than you'd think. Maybe after playing longer the game opens up, but we didn't invest much time.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Not as free
customer_reviews.text: It's more of a world where you solve everyone's problems instead of the original problem-sovled-next level thing. Not as cool on the Wii U.
customer_reviews.author: Ps2 Fanboy

product_meta.title: WB Games Scribblenauts Unlimited
product_meta.description: All-New Unbound World - Explore an open universe consisting of 41 levels with 50+ starites and 500+ starite shards accounting for 20+ hours of gameplay, and unlimited hours using every level as a playground
feature_bullets: Object Creator - Create original objects, assign unique properties, and share them with other players. Use them in game or modify them as you like!
Object Library - Store previously summoned objects and your own creations in Maxwell's magic backpack for easy access and future use.
Multiplayer Mode - Play with a friend! Drop in and take control of any object in game

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
